title: Kayak/canoeing around ChesBay watershed
name: Kayak/canoeing around ChesBay watershed
description:
A Map by Kimbere

Places my friends and I -- and any of you -- have kayaked or canoed around the &lt;b&gt;Chesapeake Bay watershed&lt;/b&gt; (NY, PA, DE, MD, VA, WV)

properties.name: Atlantic Kayak Incorporated
properties.description: Posted by LcyoungKinh Charles Terr 13600, Fort Washington, MDIf you are looking to explore the beautiful Patomac River, Atlantic Kayak, located just 15 miles from Washington, DC, is the place for you! Atlantic Kayak (located at Piscataway Kayak Center) offers guided nature tours, instruction by certified instructors, kayak rentals, and a retail store. Atlantic Kayak is open to novice paddlers and experienced kayakers.

properties.name: Bay Paddlers
properties.description: Posted by Lcyoung4055 Gordon Stinnett Ave, Chesapeake Beach, MDBay Paddlers offers a little bit of everything: rentals, tours, instrutction, kayak fishing, the works! Specializing in tours and offering everything from sunset tours, to eco-tours where you may hunt for fossils from the Miocene Era or simply keep watch for wildlife and various virds, Bay Paddlers is the place for you if you want to have a great time with a licensed guide.

properties.name: Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge
properties.description: Posted by Kimbere Blackwater was my very first kayaking experience. A department off-site "meeting" to learn more about the Chesapeake Bay. It\'s incredible to be in the midst of such quiet beauty. Saw my first bald eagles and cormorants. Interesting to find out fresh water levels are on the increase, which is beginning to affect the types of fish you find. The 720-acre restoration project should improve water quality for both the Maple Dam Branch and Little Blackwater River.

properties.name: CBF Merrill Environmental Center
properties.description: Posted by KimbereCBF is the coolest place I\'ve ever worked -- you can take the kayaks out and enjoy the Chesapeake Bay virtually anytime.

properties.name: Chester River Kayak Adventures
properties.description: Posted by Lcyoung5758 N Main St, Rock Hall, MDWith the motto, "CRKA is more an eco-tour than an athletic event... Our goal is to keep you in the boat and out of the water," it is easy to see why this Rock Hall kayaking location is ideal for the environmental adventurer. Offering five half-day tours, two full-day tours, and sunset and moonlight paddles, Chester River Kayak Adventures will take you to secluded beaches and naturally diverse coves where you may see osprey nests, abandoned duck blinds, herons, swans, and eagles. Guided tours are available and group tours are offered at discounted prices. CRKA has a variety of kayaks suited for the personal needs of each customer and will match you based on size and skill level. Children 10+ . P.O. Box 189, 5758 Main Street, Rock Hall, Maryland 21661 tel: (410) 639-2001/(410) 639-2061 e-mail crkayak@bluecrab.org

properties.name: Eastern Shore Adventure Company
properties.description: Posted by Lcyoung28290 Saint Michaels Rd, Easton, MDEastern Shore Adventure Company is located in Easton, Maryland and specializes in rentals, tour & packages, and teambuilding. Offering kayaking adventures and tours on Kings Creek Preserve, a pristine tidal marsh off of the Choptank River, the Wye River, and the Blackwater River, you are guaranteed to spot native wildlife and waterfowl in these quiet coves available for kayaking by Eastern Shore Adventure Company.

properties.name: Lower Susquehanna - Self Guided
properties.description: Posted by TackermanLower Susquehanna - An easy 4-5 mile paddle down the river, putting in at Lapidum or Conowingo Dam (lengthens the paddle to 9 mi.). You can take out in historic Havre de Grace or paddle across the Susquehanna flats and take out in Port Deposit. Deer Creek is a good side paddle on River right. Call the Conowingo Dam for water levels/release schedule before paddling, and look out for the tugs at Arundel Quarry about halfway down. Lots of birds, river islands and good fishing to explore. http://www.dnr.state.md.us/outdooradventures/canoesusq.html

properties.name: Marshy Point Nature Center
properties.description: Posted by Lcyoung 7130 Marshy Point Rd, Baltimore, MDMarshy Point Nature Center is the perfect location to visit if you are looking to canoe in pristine waters where plant and animal life is abundant. With a brand new waterfront canoe facility, pier launch site, storage center, and plenty of canoes in stock, Marshy Point offers tours with certified guides and naturalists through one of the most untouched and preserved areas on the upper Chesapeake. While paddling at Marshy Point, you may see heron, osprey, water snakes, and turtles, but if you get curious about other critters in the area, you can take a hike on the Hike and Bike trail at Marshy Point or the new nature trail system that crosses over Minnow Branch and small creeks. Marshy Point Nature Center tel: 410.887.2817

properties.name: Pocomoke State Forest, Milburn Landing State Park
properties.description: Posted by Clee put in on the Pocomoke River for an 18-mile round trip paddle to Nassawango Creek, the northernmost stand of Cypress on the East Coast

properties.name: Quiet Waters Park
properties.description: Posted by Lcyoung   , , MDHome to Amphibious Horizons, an adventure sport travel company specializing in sea kayaking, Quiet Waters Park in Annapolis is a fantastic location to explore the water- beware of the jellyfish, though! Amphibious Horizons offers single sea kayaks, sit-on-top kayaks, and also canoe rentals for those weary of the jellies. If you prefer a change in scenery and are looking for adventure, discovery, or relaxation, take a day trip with Amphibious to Mattaponi Creek, the Patuxent River, Susquehanna Flats, Fishing Creek, Tilghman, or the Wye River. Contact the company directly for classes, tours, or expeditions at 1-888-I-LUV-SUN.

properties.name: Tuckahoe State Park
properties.description: Posted by Aladley  Tuckahoe State Park is a great paddle! It can be 20 minutes or it can be 2 hours. Park at the launch spot and paddle through the SAV\'s into the dense tree-covered area. You\'ll have to turn around and come back out the same way you went in, but you can paddle back as far as you want.

properties.name: Ultimate Watersports
properties.description: Posted by Lcyoung7340 Greenbank Rd, Middle River, MDLocated at Gunpowder Falls State Park, Hammerman Area, Ultimate Watersports is the largest Kayak Outfitter on the Chesapeake Bay. With over 150 brand new kayaks to choose from and the option of lessons, tours, and rentals (on site and off), Ultimate Watersports is ideal for the beginner or seasoned kayaker. Just a quick paddle from the central beaches of the Gunpowder River, you will find two of the most pristine water trails on the Chesapeake. While paddling through Cunninghill Cove and what the locals refer to as Jenna’s Cove, it is highly likely that among the sub-aquatic vegetation and tall marsh grasses you will spot ospreys, eagles, redwing blackbirds, herons, box turtles, water snakes, eels, and red foxes. Ultimate Watersports also offers kayak rentals and kayak-fishing rentals at Dundee Creek, a perfect spot for an afternoon with the family (and dog, if desired)! Ultimate Watersports tel: 410-335-5352.
